intro: Oreobliton thesioides, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow composite flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy seed heads. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Oreobliton thesioides plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small invertebrates.
